A strong emphasis is placed on experiential learning through internships, service-learning, and research opportunities. The Health Science Studies major is housed within the Department of Health, Human Performance, and Recreation. It is offered through the Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Health Science Studies

Concentration name: ['All-Level Physical Education Teacher Certification', 'Exercise Physiology', 'Health Sciences', 'Leisure Studies', 'Pre-physical Therapy/Pre-occupational Therapy']
description: The Bachelor of Science in Health, Kinesiology, and Leisure Studies degree provides students with a strong scientific and practical foundation applicable to a broad spectrum of career fields within health, kinesiology, and leisure. The program’s curriculum encompasses diverse areas such as human anatomy and physiology, exercise physiology, biomechanics, motor learning, health promotion, nutrition, and leisure behavior. Graduates are prepared for professions in fitness, health and wellness, sport management, outdoor recreation, and community health. Additionally, this degree provides a solid foundation for graduate studies in allied health fields, including physical therapy, occupational therapy, and chiropractic medicine, as well as graduate programs in exercise science, public health, and leisure studies.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Health, Kinesiology, and Leisure Studies

description: The study of history provides students with an understanding of the past that helps them make sense of the present and prepare for the future. The ability to understand the context and causes of change across time, to analyze primary and secondary sources, to construct sound arguments, and to communicate effectively are skills essential for good citizenship and for success in virtually any career path. Students earning a BA in History at Baylor can pursue a wide range of graduate studies and professions, including law, journalism, government, foreign service, business, education, museum work, and public history.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in History
Minor in History
Minor in Human Resource Management

description: This minor is designed to provide students with a foundational understanding of the theory and practice of informal education. Students will explore how learning occurs in non-traditional settings such as museums, zoos, parks, community centers, and after-school programs. The curriculum emphasizes the design, implementation, and evaluation of engaging educational experiences for diverse audiences. Students will develop skills in creating impactful learning opportunities outside the formal classroom, preparing them for roles in various educational and community organizations.
Program name: Minor in Informal Education

description: The Bachelor of Music Education in Instrumental Music degree offers a comprehensive curriculum for students interested in teaching instrumental music in public schools, private schools, or other educational settings. This program prepares students to become certified music educators and develop the pedagogical skills necessary to teach band, orchestra, or general music classes. The curriculum combines rigorous music training with educational theory and practical teaching experiences, including student teaching in various school environments.
Program name: Bachelor of Music Education in Instrumental Music

description: Baylor's interior design program is an undergraduate program offering a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree. The curriculum emphasizes a holistic approach to design, integrating creativity, technical skills, critical thinking, and social responsibility. Students engage in hands-on projects, studio work, and real-world experiences, preparing them for diverse careers in the interior design field.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA) through Fall 2028.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Interior Design
Bachelor of Business Administration in International Business

Concentration name: Diplomacy, Security, and Foreign Policy; Global Social Justice and Human Rights; International Development
description: International Studies prepares students to understand and address complex global challenges from a Christian perspective. The interdisciplinary curriculum equips students to analyze global processes, engage diverse cultures, and contribute to the common good in an interconnected world. Students develop critical thinking, communication, and cross-cultural competencies essential for careers in international diplomacy, non-governmental organizations, business, and further graduate study.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in International Studies

description: A minor in Italian gives students the opportunity to learn a language and explore the literature, history and culture of Italy. This program teaches students to speak, read, and write Italian and is open to all majors.
Program name: Minor in Italian

description: The Minor in Japanese allows students to acquire competency in spoken and written Japanese and an understanding of the Japanese culture. The Minor in Japanese requires a minimum of 18 semester hours from courses above JPN 1302. Students must be able to place into JPN 2301 or higher to declare the minor. Students who place into JPN 1301 or 1302 and continue on to take courses above JPN 1302 must take 18 hours of JPN courses above JPN 1302 for the minor. Students who place into JPN 2301 or higher must take 18 hours of JPN courses at the 2000-level or higher for the minor. At least twelve semester hours must be taken in residence at Baylor University. All courses counted toward the minor must be passed with a grade of "C" or better.
Program name: Minor in Japanese

description: Journalists write and edit for newspapers, magazines, radio, television and the Internet. They inform the public and cover breaking news, politics, crime, sports and entertainment. They hold government officials and public figures accountable and tell compelling stories that shape public opinion and impact lives. A journalism degree teaches students how to gather, report and disseminate information in an accurate, fair and compelling way. It also provides training in media ethics, law, history, and theory.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Journalism
